Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the involvement of the Kray twins in the image and their use of an elephant to carry out their crimes.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the image does not feature the Kray twins and was not taken in 1960.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the provided claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by providing misinformation about the Kray twins' involvement and the timeline of the image.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or credible sources linking the Kray twins to the image or their use of an elephant in their crimes.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that the image is connected to the Kray twins' reign of terror in London.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not provide any alternative explanations for the image or its association with the Kray twins.
